channel.title: Github on My digital brain
channel.description: Recent content in Github on My digital brain

item.title: GISCUS - You can now add comments to my blog
item.description: When I was researching some stuff for a blog post about Github Actions, I stumbled over the blog from Github user @nicolasiensen. When I read the post, I saw that people were able to add comments with being logged into Github. Something like this I have seen a long time ago, but this was so complicated, I just ignored it. But now as I saw in his blog , it’s super ways, thanks to Giscus

item.title: Getting a verified user on Github
item.description: sdfasdfdsa sfdsf xxxxxx When you create a new file directly on Github and push it to your branch, you will see in the commit, that this was done by an verified user. If you push it from your command line, it normally looks like this: P.S. if you followed the tutorial, and something went wrong, it will look like this: But let’s start from the beginning! First of all: Github gives you a great Readme for this, that’s why I link it here were needed.
